column2: ASHES OF TINDER: A FACE AT THE WINDOW

column2: That night Hurstwood remained down town entirely, going to the Palmer House for a bed after his work was through.

column2: He was in a fevered state of mind, owing to the blight his wife's action threatened to cast upon his entire future.
column3: He was in a fevered state of mind, owing to the blight his wife's action threatened to cast upon his entire future.

column2: While he was not sure how much significance might be attached to the threat she had made, he was sure that her attitude, if long continued, would cause him no end of trouble.
column3: While he was not sure how much significance might be attached to the threat she had made, he was sure that her attitude, if long continued, would cause him no end of trouble.

column2: She was determined, and had worsted him in a very important contest.

column2: He walked the floor of his little office, and later that of his room, putting one thing and another together to no avail.

column2: He would have to pay her the money which she would now regularly demand or there would be trouble.

column2: She would find out at once just what advantages she could gain.

column2: He began to feel the appetite that had been wanting before he had reached the office, and decided before going out to the park to meet Carrie to drop in at the Grand Pacific and have a pot of coffee and some rolls.

column2: He went in and examined his letters, but there was nothing from Carrie. Fortunately, there was nothing from his wife either.

column2: He thanked his stars that he did not have to confront that proposition just now when he needed to think so much.

column2: Damn her! he said softly, with his teeth firmly set, "I'll make it hot for her if she causes me trouble.

column2: I'll make her change her tone if I have to use force to do it!"

column2: By the time he reached his own street he was keenly alive to the difficulties of his situation and wished over and over that some solution would offer itself, that he could see his way out.
column3: By the time he reached his own street he was keenly alive to the difficulties of his situation and wished over and over that some solution would offer itself, that he could see his way out.

column2: He alighted and went up the steps to the front door, but it was with a nervous palpitation of the heart.
column3: He alighted and went up the steps to the front door, but it was with a nervous palpitation of the heart.

column2: He pulled out his key and tried to insert it, but another key was on the inside.
column3: He pulled out his key and tried to insert it, but another key was on the inside.

column2: He shook at the knob, but the door was locked.
column3: He shook at the knob, but the door was locked.

column2: He rang again--this time harder.

column2: He jangled it fiercely several times in succession, but without avail.

column2: Finally, seeing that no one was coming, he turned and went back to his cab.
column3: Finally, seeing that no one was coming, he turned and went back to his cab.
